snippet: Courts in the western region of Xinjiang sentenced the defendants for a wide range of crimes, including organizing and taking part in terrorist organizations, state media reported.
abstract: Courts in western Chinese region of Xinjiang sentence 113 people to prison terms for wide range of crimes, including organizing and taking part in terrorist organization; all those sentenced have ethnic Uighur names, pointing to conflict between majority Han Chinese and Uighurs.
lead_paragraph: Courts in the western region of Xinjiang sentenced the defendants for a wide range of crimes, including organizing and taking part in terrorist organizations, state media reported.

headline.main: China Sentences 113 to Prison in Xinjiang Region
